casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Harding Troy KENDRICK, Defendant-Appellant. No. 71-3080. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Aug. 1, 1972. Morton L. Shatzkin (argued), Studio City, Cal., for defendant-appellant. Robert C. Bonner, Asst. U. S. Atty. (argued), Erie A. Nobles, Asst. U. S. Atty., William D. Keller, U. S. Atty., Los Angeles, Cal., for plaintiff-appellee.

Before CHAMBERS, JERTBERG and MERRILL, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The judgment of conviction in this case involving counterfeit currency is affirmed.

Exception is taken to matters involving the trial court’s discretion. We find no error.
